bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, November 1, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: CONSULAR BUREAU. Acknowledge & send copies to the St. Louis Expedition Co.

div1.p: No. 85. Consular. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, November 1, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State Washington.

p.add: Copy to D. R. Francis ackd by form Dec 6 1901

div1.p: Subject. The transmission of copies of official correspondence between this Consulate General and the Liberian Government.
No. 85. Consular. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, November 1, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.
Sir: I have the honor to transmit, herewith, copies of official Consulor correspondence between this Consulate General and the Liberian Government.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith Consul General.
No. 41/1901. Miscellaneous. Legation of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, Oct. 11, 1901.
Hon. W. V. Gibson, Acting Secretary of State, Monrovia.

Sir: By direction of the Secretary of State Washington, I have the honor to hand you herewith, copies of the regulations, also the act of COngress of March 3, 1901, providing for; as well as the regulations issued by the Secretary of the Treasury for the admission of exhibits to the "Louisiana Purchase Exposition" free of duty. I am further directed to assure your Excellency that the Government of the united States still further directs me to emphasis the fact that it is the earnest desire thereof, to see your Government suitably represented at said Louisiana Purchase Exposition.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant, Owen L. W. Smith, Minister Resident.

Sir: I have the honor to be in receipt of your dispatch of the 11th inst. forwarding this Department under seperate covers copies of the regulations also the Acts of Congress of March 3 20, 1901, providing for as well as the regulations issued by the Secretary of the Treasury for the admission of the Exhibits of the "Louisana Purchase Exposition, free of duty, for which please accept the tanks of the Department. You are further pleased to assure me of the earnestness of your Government that this Government be suitably represented at said "Louisiana Purchase Exposition" which no doubt will be the case.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant, W. V. Gibson, Acting Sec of State
Hon. O. L. W. Smith U.S. Minister Resident & Consul Gen'l Monrovia
No. 42/1901, Miscellaneous Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, October 17, 1901.
To the Honorable The Special Commissions, Monrovia, Liberia.
